content.sentence: Emergency Care Special Interest Group – HL7

content.sentence: Introduction
content.parserSentence: Introduction

content.sentence: The EDIS Functional Profile (EDIS-FP) project of the HL7 Emergency Care Special Interest Group (EC-SIG) is aimed at developing an HL7 Normative Functional Profile for emergency department information systems, conforming to the HL7
content.parserSentence: The EDIS Functional Profile (EDIS-FP) project of the HL7 Emergency Care Special Interest Group (EC-SIG) is aimed at developing an HL7 Normative Functional Profile for emergency department information systems, conforming to the HL7

content.sentence: Electronic Health Record (EHR) Functional Model.
content.parserSentence: Electronic Health Record (EHR) Functional Model.

content.sentence: By creating a robust and usable functional profile outlining the essential functions of an EDIS, and including specific conformance criteria for their evaluation, we hope to develop an open and objective standard for the development, refinement, evaluation of information systems employed in the ED.
content.parserSentence: By creating a robust and usable functional profile outlining the essential functions of an EDIS, and including specific conformance criteria for their evaluation, we hope to develop an open and objective standard for the development, refinement, evaluation of information systems employed in the ED.

content.sentence: Background
content.parserSentence: Background

content.sentence: Founded in 1987, Health Level Seven is a not-for-profit healthcare standards development organization (SDO) accredited by the American National Standards Institute (ANSI).
content.parserSentence: Founded in 1987, Health Level Seven is a not-for-profit healthcare standards development organization (SDO) accredited by the American National Standards Institute (ANSI).

content.sentence: While traditionally involved in the development of messaging standards used by healthcare systems to exchange data, HL7 has begun to develop other standards related to healthcare information systems.
content.parserSentence: While traditionally involved in the development of messaging standards used by healthcare systems to exchange data, HL7 has begun to develop other standards related to healthcare information systems.

content.sentence: In 2002, a newly formed HL7 EHR special interest group began development of a functional model for electronic health record systems (EHR-S).
content.parserSentence: In 2002, a newly formed HL7 EHR special interest group began development of a functional model for electronic health record systems (EHR-S).

content.sentence: Shortly thereafter, a number of organizations approached HL7 to develop a consensus standard to define the necessary functions for an EHR-S.
content.parserSentence: Shortly thereafter, a number of organizations approached HL7 to develop a consensus standard to define the necessary functions for an EHR-S.

content.sentence: The EHR SIG was promoted to a full technical committee, and in 2004 published the EHR-S Functional Model as a Draft Standard for Trail Use (DSTU).
content.parserSentence: The EHR SIG was promoted to a full technical committee, and in 2004 published the EHR-S Functional Model as a Draft Standard for Trail Use (DSTU).

content.sentence: The Functional Model underwent membership level ballot in September of 2006 and January 2007, and was approved as standard in February 2007.
content.parserSentence: The Functional Model underwent membership level ballot in September of 2006 and January 2007, and was approved as standard in February 2007.

content.sentence: The EHR-TC intends that unique functional profiles (herein referred to as profiles) be developed by subject matter experts in various care settings and specialties (i.e. behavioral health, inpatient, anesthesia, long-term care) to inform developers, purchasers, and other stakeholders of the functional requirements of systems developed for these domains.
content.parserSentence: The EHR-TC intends that unique functional profiles (herein referred to as profiles) be developed by subject matter experts in various care settings and specialties (i.e. behavioral health, inpatient, anesthesia, long-term care) to inform developers, purchasers, and other stakeholders of the functional requirements of systems developed for these domains.

content.sentence: The HL7 EC-SIG was founded last year to inform HL7 and other healthcare standards development organizations (SDOs) of the unique requirements and workflows of emergency care.
content.parserSentence: The HL7 EC-SIG was founded last year to inform HL7 and other healthcare standards development organizations (SDOs) of the unique requirements and workflows of emergency care.

content.sentence: In an effort to obtain the widest participation possible, the EC-SIG co-chairs solicited input and membership from domestic and international specialty societies, including ACEP, SAEM, AAEM, ENA, and the Canadian and Australasian Emergency Medicine Societies.
content.parserSentence: In an effort to obtain the widest participation possible, the EC-SIG co-chairs solicited input and membership from domestic and international specialty societies, including ACEP, SAEM, AAEM, ENA, and the Canadian and Australasian Emergency Medicine Societies.

content.sentence: Participation was solicited from the vendor community through invitations and presentations.
content.parserSentence: Participation was solicited from the vendor community through invitations and presentations.

content.sentence: At the initial meeting of the SIG, the co-chairs unanimously agreed that one of its initial work products be a functional profile for EDIS.
content.parserSentence: At the initial meeting of the SIG, the co-chairs unanimously agreed that one of its initial work products be a functional profile for EDIS.

content.sentence: The American College of Emergency Physicians (ACEP) sponsored membership in the EC-SIG in the form of funded awards for travel and expenses to HL7 meetings.
content.parserSentence: The American College of Emergency Physicians (ACEP) sponsored membership in the EC-SIG in the form of funded awards for travel and expenses to HL7 meetings.

content.sentence: Infrastructure was secured from an unrestricted grant from XPress Technologies to set up an intranet site and weekly teleconferences to supplement face to face meetings at HL7 conferences.
content.parserSentence: Infrastructure was secured from an unrestricted grant from XPress Technologies to set up an intranet site and weekly teleconferences to supplement face to face meetings at HL7 conferences.

content.sentence: An EDIS-FP workgroup was convened that currently includes over thirty physicians, nurses, medical informatics experts, EDIS developers, and engineers.
content.parserSentence: An EDIS-FP workgroup was convened that currently includes over thirty physicians, nurses, medical informatics experts, EDIS developers, and engineers.

content.sentence: Membership in HL7 is not a prerequisite for participation.
content.parserSentence: Membership in HL7 is not a prerequisite for participation.

content.sentence: The Certification Commission on Health Information Technology (CCHIT) adopted the EHR FM in 2005 as a tool for evaluation of ambulatory systems.
content.parserSentence: The Certification Commission on Health Information Technology (CCHIT) adopted the EHR FM in 2005 as a tool for evaluation of ambulatory systems.

content.sentence: Based upon evaluation criteria developed from the EHR Functional Model, CCHIT began certification of these systems in 2006.
content.parserSentence: Based upon evaluation criteria developed from the EHR Functional Model, CCHIT began certification of these systems in 2006.

content.sentence: CCHIT recognizes the value of expanding certification to address particular specialties, care settings, and specific patient populations, and has begun pursuing expansion of certification.
content.parserSentence: CCHIT recognizes the value of expanding certification to address particular specialties, care settings, and specific patient populations, and has begun pursuing expansion of certification.

content.sentence: ACEP endorsed concept of certification and the development of a unique EDIS-FP in a letter to CCHIT in 2005, and began coordinating activities with the SIG and WG to promote adoption of the FP as the basis for CCHIT certification for EDIS.
content.parserSentence: ACEP endorsed concept of certification and the development of a unique EDIS-FP in a letter to CCHIT in 2005, and began coordinating activities with the SIG and WG to promote adoption of the FP as the basis for CCHIT certification for EDIS.

content.sentence: In January, the EC-SIG and ACEP coauthored a response to the CCHIT environmental scan further promoting the EDIS FP as the principle framework for developing EDIS certification.
content.parserSentence: In January, the EC-SIG and ACEP coauthored a response to the CCHIT environmental scan further promoting the EDIS FP as the principle framework for developing EDIS certification.

content.sentence: On the basis of this profile development, CCHIT announced their proposal to expand certification to EDIS systems in February of 2007, with certification commencing sometime in late 2008 or early 2009.
content.parserSentence: On the basis of this profile development, CCHIT announced their proposal to expand certification to EDIS systems in February of 2007, with certification commencing sometime in late 2008 or early 2009.

content.sentence: Methods and Project  Plan
content.parserSentence: Methods and Project  Plan

content.sentence: The project was structured into four discrete phases:
content.parserSentence: The project was structured into four discrete phases:

content.sentence: 1)   Organization – solicitation of participants, determination of scope and care setting of profile, and development of project plan and overview.
content.parserSentence: The project was structured into four discrete phases: Organization – solicitation of participants, determination of scope and care setting of profile, and development of project plan and overview.

content.sentence: 2)   Formalization – step by step development of EDIS functions and conformance criteria.
content.parserSentence: The project was structured into four discrete phases: Formalization – step by step development of EDIS functions and conformance criteria.

content.sentence: 3)   Harmonization –comparison with, incorporation into, and alignment with the EHR FM.
content.parserSentence: The project was structured into four discrete phases: Harmonization –comparison with, incorporation into, and alignment with the EHR FM.

content.sentence: • Define functional priorities and timeframes (see below) for functions
content.parserSentence: Define functional priorities and timeframes (see below) for functions

content.sentence: • Accept or reject other functions from FM.
content.parserSentence: Accept or reject other functions from FM.

content.sentence: • Incorporate unique EDIS functions defined in step 2 through sibling child relationships with EHR FM functions
content.parserSentence: Incorporate unique EDIS functions defined in step 2 through sibling child relationships with EHR FM functions

content.sentence: • Incorporate and modify conformance criteria
content.parserSentence: Incorporate and modify conformance criteria

content.sentence: 4)   Finalization – attention to detail, wording, language, and conformance in preparation for EHR – TC registration, verification and balloting.
content.parserSentence: Finalization – attention to detail, wording, language, and conformance in preparation for EHR – TC registration, verification and balloting.

content.sentence: We began the EDIS-FP project by taking a broad look at the functions required of ED systems, with only organizational reference to the EHR FM.
content.parserSentence: We began the EDIS-FP project by taking a broad look at the functions required of ED systems, with only organizational reference to the EHR FM.

content.sentence: We employed this methodology to maximize the potential discovery of functions that the EHR- TC may not have considered in the FM.
content.parserSentence: We employed this methodology to maximize the potential discovery of functions that the EHR- TC may not have considered in the FM.

content.sentence: It has also permitted us to approach the project using an outline familiar to people working in emergency medicine.
content.parserSentence: It has also permitted us to approach the project using an outline familiar to people working in emergency medicine.

content.sentence: We began with a typical scope of ED care, beginning with a “heads-up” and moving through patient arrival, triage, nursing and physician assessment, orders, results, procedures, ongoing assessments, and finally admit or transfer or discharge planning.
content.parserSentence: We began with a typical scope of ED care, beginning with a “heads-up” and moving through patient arrival, triage, nursing and physician assessment, orders, results, procedures, ongoing assessments, and finally admit or transfer or discharge planning.

content.sentence: Use case methodology was employed where appropriate.
content.parserSentence: Use case methodology was employed where appropriate.

content.sentence: Harmonization of the workgroup product and the EHR FM was performed in order for the profile to become an HL7 Balloted Functional Profile.
content.parserSentence: Harmonization of the workgroup product and the EHR FM was performed in order for the profile to become an HL7 Balloted Functional Profile.

content.sentence: First time readers should be understand that the EHR-TC has defined specific methodologies for profile development and conformance, which are outlined in the How-To Guide for Creating Functional Profiles and Conformance Clause sections of the EHR functional model.
content.parserSentence: First time readers should be understand that the EHR-TC has defined specific methodologies for profile development and conformance, which are outlined in the How-To Guide for Creating Functional Profiles and Conformance Clause sections of the EHR functional model.

content.sentence: The workgroup has identified a writing committee and is in the process of publish a summary document targeted to practicing emergency department providers and managers to use as a guide to system evaluation and selection.
content.parserSentence: The workgroup has identified a writing committee and is in the process of publish a summary document targeted to practicing emergency department providers and managers to use as a guide to system evaluation and selection.

content.sentence: The development of the EDIS FP has and continues to employ a traditional, open, standards development approach.
content.parserSentence: The development of the EDIS FP has and continues to employ a traditional, open, standards development approach.

content.sentence: Everyone’s contributions and concerns are addressed, and your input is welcome.
content.parserSentence: Everyone’s contributions and concerns are addressed, and your input is welcome.

content.sentence: EDIS: Definition, Standards, Implementation and Interoperability
content.parserSentence: EDIS: Definition, Standards, Implementation and Interoperability

content.sentence: An Emergency  Department  Information System (EDIS) is an extended EHR system  used to manage data in support of Emergency  Department patient care and operations.
content.parserSentence: An Emergency  Department  Information System (EDIS) is an extended EHR system  used to manage data in support of Emergency  Department patient care and operations.

content.sentence: The functions of an EDIS may be provided by a single application or multiple applications.
content.parserSentence: The functions of an EDIS may be provided by a single application or multiple applications.

content.sentence: Standards  Basis for this EDIS Definition: The EDIS functional profile is a standards work derived from the HL7 EHR Functional Model, which is in turn based on ISO or TR-20514 Health informatics -- Electronic health record -- Definition, scope and context.
content.parserSentence: Standards  Basis for this EDIS Definition: The EDIS functional profile is a standards work derived from the HL7 EHR Functional Model, which is in turn based on ISO or TR-20514 Health informatics -- Electronic health record -- Definition, scope and context.

content.sentence: According to the ISO EHR standard:
content.parserSentence: According to the ISO EHR standard:

content.sentence: “The primary purpose of the EHR is to provide a documented record of care that supports present and future care by the same or other clinicians…Any other purpose for which the health record is used may be considered secondary.”
content.parserSentence: “The primary purpose of the EHR is to provide a documented record of care that supports present and future care by the same or other clinicians…Any other purpose for which the health record is used may be considered secondary.”

content.sentence: “The Core EHR contains principally clinical information; it is therefore chiefly focused on the primary purpose.
content.parserSentence: “The Core EHR contains principally clinical information; it is therefore chiefly focused on the primary purpose.

content.sentence: The Core EHR is a subset of the Extended EHR.
content.parserSentence: The Core EHR is a subset of the Extended EHR.

content.sentence: The Extended EHR includes the whole health information landscape; its focus therefore is not only on the primary purpose, but also on all of the secondary purposes as well.
content.parserSentence: The Extended EHR includes the whole health information landscape; its focus therefore is not only on the primary purpose, but also on all of the secondary purposes as well.

content.sentence: The Extended EHR is a superset of the Core EHR.”
content.parserSentence: The Extended EHR is a superset of the Core EHR.”

content.sentence: The EDIS FP workgroup decided that while many of the functions that form a traditional EDIS (i.e. charting, order entry, results reporting, and) may constitute core EHR functions, other functions (i.e. patient tracking, disposition management, financial, and administrative) clearly constitute important secondary uses of an EDIS.
content.parserSentence: The EDIS FP workgroup decided that while many of the functions that form a traditional EDIS (i.e. charting, order entry, results reporting, and) may constitute core EHR functions, other functions (i.e. patient tracking, disposition management, financial, and administrative) clearly constitute important secondary uses of an EDIS.

content.sentence: Systems, Components & Applications: Emergency departments have fundamental commonalities, but each is also different.
content.parserSentence: Systems, Components & Applications: Emergency departments have fundamental commonalities, but each is also different.

content.sentence: Each EDIS may likely consist of a collection of systems, applications, modules, or components, developed on different architectures.
content.parserSentence: Each EDIS may likely consist of a collection of systems, applications, modules, or components, developed on different architectures.

content.sentence: For example, an ED might pair one vendor's clinical documentation system with another's tracking, discharge, or prescribing system.
content.parserSentence: For example, an ED might pair one vendor's clinical documentation system with another's tracking, discharge, or prescribing system.

content.sentence: Hence, an EDIS may be provided by a single vendor, multiple vendors, or by one or more development teams.
content.parserSentence: Hence, an EDIS may be provided by a single vendor, multiple vendors, or by one or more development teams.

content.sentence: Interoperability: All components, modules, or applications within an EDIS should respond to users in a well integrated fashion.
content.parserSentence: Interoperability: All components, modules, or applications within an EDIS should respond to users in a well integrated fashion.

content.sentence: Thus each component, module or application must be interoperable to the degree required by the function description and conformance criteria specified in this profile.
content.parserSentence: Thus each component, module or application must be interoperable to the degree required by the function description and conformance criteria specified in this profile.

content.sentence: ISO 20514 states: The key to interoperability is through standardization of requirements for the EHR (record) architecture (e.g. ISO or TS 18308:2004) and ultimately the standardization of the EHR architecture itself (e.g. ENV 13606-1:2000).
content.parserSentence: ISO 20514 states: The key to interoperability is through standardization of requirements for the EHR (record) architecture (e.g. ISO or TS 18308:2004) and ultimately the standardization of the EHR architecture itself (e.g. ENV 13606-1:2000).

content.sentence: Organization of this Document
content.parserSentence: Organization of this Document

content.sentence: The profile is divided into three sections: Direct Care, Supportive Functions and Information Infrastructure.
content.parserSentence: The profile is divided into three sections: Direct Care, Supportive Functions and Information Infrastructure.

content.sentence: Each section defines a broad category of functions applicable to an EDIS.
content.parserSentence: Each section defines a broad category of functions applicable to an EDIS.

content.sentence: Because of this organization, many traditional concepts and tasks typical of traditional ED can be found interspersed throughout the document, depending upon whether aspects constitute patient tracking, administrative functions, clinical workflow, tasks or orders, clinical documentation, or clinical decision support, etc.
content.parserSentence: Because of this organization, many traditional concepts and tasks typical of traditional ED can be found interspersed throughout the document, depending upon whether aspects constitute patient tracking, administrative functions, clinical workflow, tasks or orders, clinical documentation, or clinical decision support, etc.

content.sentence: For example, items related to the ED triage process can be found in documentation as well as clinical decision support.
content.parserSentence: For example, items related to the ED triage process can be found in documentation as well as clinical decision support.

content.sentence: Readers looking for a general overview of typical ED functions should refer to the EDIS Overview and Functions section at the end of this introduction.
content.parserSentence: Readers looking for a general overview of typical ED functions should refer to the EDIS Overview and Functions section at the end of this introduction.

content.sentence: Direct care functions are the subset of functions that enable delivery of healthcare or offer clinical decision support.

content.sentence: These functions are not involved in the provision of healthcare, but are necessary to ensure that the EDIS provides safeguards for patient safety, privacy and information security, as well as operational efficiencies and minimum standards for interoperability.

content.sentence: Functional Priorities
content.parserSentence: Functional Priorities

content.sentence: The EHR TC and EC-SIG recognize that clinical computing is an evolving field, and that many of the desired functions of EHR-S are not currently available.
content.parserSentence: The EHR TC and EC-SIG recognize that clinical computing is an evolving field, and that many of the desired functions of EHR-S are not currently available.

content.sentence: Certain functions, for instance access to regional health information, may not be feasible or essential now because widespread adoption of regional health information organizations (RHIOs) has yet to occur.
content.parserSentence: Certain functions, for instance access to regional health information, may not be feasible or essential now because widespread adoption of regional health information organizations (RHIOs) has yet to occur.

content.sentence: Nevertheless, it is important for functional profiles to outline major trends and articulate a vision for functionality (especially interoperability) for the future.
content.parserSentence: Nevertheless, it is important for functional profiles to outline major trends and articulate a vision for functionality (especially interoperability) for the future.

content.sentence: Furthermore, the delineation of potential functions for future implementation and adoption should guide vendors in development, and help purchasers develop and articulate to vendors a strategic vision for future functional requirements.
content.parserSentence: Furthermore, the delineation of potential functions for future implementation and adoption should guide vendors in development, and help purchasers develop and articulate to vendors a strategic vision for future functional requirements.

content.sentence: Each function in the profile is assigned a single priority as follows:
content.parserSentence: Each function in the profile is assigned a single priority as follows:

content.sentence: E Essential Now
content.parserSentence: E Essential Now

content.sentence: The function must be available and users must be able to implement it.
content.parserSentence: The function must be available and users must be able to implement it.

content.sentence: In assigning this priority, the workgroup believes that the function is critical to the delivery of care in the ED.
content.parserSentence: In assigning this priority, the workgroup believes that the function is critical to the delivery of care in the ED.

content.sentence: When determining the priority for a particular function, the workgroup determined that such functions should support the delivery of effective healthcare, ensure patient safety, and maximize ED efficiency.
content.parserSentence: When determining the priority for a particular function, the workgroup determined that such functions should support the delivery of effective healthcare, ensure patient safety, and maximize ED efficiency.

content.sentence: E   Essential Future
content.parserSentence: E   Essential Future

content.sentence: The function must be available and users must be able to implement it before the two  digit year indicated.
content.parserSentence: The function must be available and users must be able to implement it before the two  digit year indicated.

content.sentence: In assigning this priority, the workgroup understands that these functions may not be available at present, but are part of a general trend towards additional functionality that should be possible as standards development and IT implementations mature.
content.parserSentence: In assigning this priority, the workgroup understands that these functions may not be available at present, but are part of a general trend towards additional functionality that should be possible as standards development and IT implementations mature.

content.sentence: The assignment of these functions should inform system developers and purchasers of a general roadmap for future functionality in EDIS.
content.parserSentence: The assignment of these functions should inform system developers and purchasers of a general roadmap for future functionality in EDIS.

content.sentence: O Optional
content.parserSentence: O Optional

content.sentence: The function is desirable but not a critical component of an EDIS.
content.parserSentence: The function is desirable but not a critical component of an EDIS.

content.sentence: In assigning this priority, the workgroup believes that these functions should be considered helpful features of an EDIS, but are not critical for ED care or operations.

content.sentence: As the EHR Functional model has recently been approved as standard, we anticipate that in the near future a revision will be released that conforms to the approved standard.
content.parserSentence: As the EHR Functional model has recently been approved as standard, we anticipate that in the near future a revision will be released that conforms to the approved standard.

content.sentence: Key to the Functional Model and derived profiles is the concept of conformance which may be defined as “verification that an implementation faithfully meets the requirements of a standard or specification” .
content.parserSentence: Key to the Functional Model and derived profiles is the concept of conformance which may be defined as “verification that an implementation faithfully meets the requirements of a standard or specification” .

content.sentence: In the functional model and in derived profiles, the general concept of conformance may be expressed a number of forms.
content.parserSentence: In the functional model and in derived profiles, the general concept of conformance may be expressed a number of forms.

content.sentence: For instance, a profile can be said to conform to the functional model if it adheres to the defined rules specified by the functional model specification.
content.parserSentence: For instance, a profile can be said to conform to the functional model if it adheres to the defined rules specified by the functional model specification.

content.sentence: Similarly, an EDIS may claim conformance to this profile if it meets all the requirements outlined in the profile.
content.parserSentence: Similarly, an EDIS may claim conformance to this profile if it meets all the requirements outlined in the profile.

content.sentence: Conformance of ED Information Systems
content.parserSentence: Conformance of ED Information Systems

content.sentence: This EDIS Functional Profile defines two levels of conformance for an EHR system or systems employed in the emergency department domain.
content.parserSentence: This EDIS Functional Profile defines two levels of conformance for an EHR system or systems employed in the emergency department domain.

content.sentence: 1)   “Basic Conformance” is comprised of the functions designated as ‘Essential Now’.
content.parserSentence: “Basic Conformance” is comprised of the functions designated as ‘Essential Now’.

content.sentence: • As of the date of this publication, to claim “Basic Conformance” with the EDIS FP, an EHR system shall include all functions designated as ‘Essential Now’, and each function must satisfy the conformance criteria designated as ‘SHALL’.
content.parserSentence: As of the date of this publication, to claim “Basic Conformance” with the EDIS FP, an EHR system shall include all functions designated as ‘Essential Now’, and each function must satisfy the conformance criteria designated as ‘SHALL’.

content.sentence: • In the future, and until such time as this Functional Profile is revised, to claim “Basic Conformance” with the EDIS FP, a EHR system shall include all functions designated as ‘Essential Future’ with the implementation year equal to or less than the year in which conformance is claimed, as well as functions designated as ‘Essential Now’, and each function must satisfy the conformance criteria designated as ‘SHALL’.
content.parserSentence: In the future, and until such time as this Functional Profile is revised, to claim “Basic Conformance” with the EDIS FP, a EHR system shall include all functions designated as ‘Essential Future’ with the implementation year equal to or less than the year in which conformance is claimed, as well as functions designated as ‘Essential Now’, and each function must satisfy the conformance criteria designated as ‘SHALL’.

content.sentence: 2)   “Advanced Conformance” comprises the set of functions designated as ‘Essential Now’ as well as ‘Optional’.
content.parserSentence: “Advanced Conformance” comprises the set of functions designated as ‘Essential Now’ as well as ‘Optional’.

content.sentence: • As of the date of this publication, to claim “Advanced Conformance” with the EDIS FP, an EHR system shall include all functions designated as ‘Essential Now’ and ‘Optional’, and each function must satisfy the conformance criteria designated as ‘SHALL’.
content.parserSentence: As of the date of this publication, to claim “Advanced Conformance” with the EDIS FP, an EHR system shall include all functions designated as ‘Essential Now’ and ‘Optional’, and each function must satisfy the conformance criteria designated as ‘SHALL’.

content.sentence: • In the future, and until such time as this Functional Profile is revised, to claim “Advanced Conformance” with the EDIS FP, a EHR system shall include all functions designated as ‘Essential Now’ or ‘Essential Future’ with the implementation year equal to or less than the year in which conformance is claimed, as well as functions designated as ‘Optional’, and each function must satisfy the conformance criteria designated as ‘SHALL’.
content.parserSentence: In the future, and until such time as this Functional Profile is revised, to claim “Advanced Conformance” with the EDIS FP, a EHR system shall include all functions designated as ‘Essential Now’ or ‘Essential Future’ with the implementation year equal to or less than the year in which conformance is claimed, as well as functions designated as ‘Optional’, and each function must satisfy the conformance criteria designated as ‘SHALL’.

content.sentence: Conformance of Derived Profiles
content.parserSentence: Conformance of Derived Profiles

content.sentence: The EDIS Functional Profile Working Group recognizes that developers, users, and other members of the EDIS community may wish to develop their own profiles.
content.parserSentence: The EDIS Functional Profile Working Group recognizes that developers, users, and other members of the EDIS community may wish to develop their own profiles.

content.sentence: The Working Group contends that the EDIS FP includes all the functions that might be reasonably expected to be available in an EDIS.
content.parserSentence: The Working Group contends that the EDIS FP includes all the functions that might be reasonably expected to be available in an EDIS.

content.sentence: However, we also recognize the value in the development of derived profiles applicable to certain subsets of EDIS systems.
content.parserSentence: However, we also recognize the value in the development of derived profiles applicable to certain subsets of EDIS systems.

content.sentence: In fact, the workgroup strongly feels that the development of derived profiles will likely be essential to support the evaluation of systems designed to support subsets of EDIS functions.
content.parserSentence: In fact, the workgroup strongly feels that the development of derived profiles will likely be essential to support the evaluation of systems designed to support subsets of EDIS functions.

content.sentence: Based upon feedback from vendors, we anticipate that derived profiles for tracking and clinical documentation should be developed to support certification in those niches within the EDIS space.
content.parserSentence: Based upon feedback from vendors, we anticipate that derived profiles for tracking and clinical documentation should be developed to support certification in those niches within the EDIS space.

content.sentence: Other profiles may be required.
content.parserSentence: Other profiles may be required.

content.sentence: In order for a derived profile to claim conformance with the EDIS FP, the profile must include all essential functions as outlined above.
content.parserSentence: In order for a derived profile to claim conformance with the EDIS FP, the profile must include all essential functions as outlined above.

content.sentence: Furthermore, a derived profile must not claim conformance if the derived profile includes functions that have not been defined in this EDIS FP.
content.parserSentence: Furthermore, a derived profile must not claim conformance if the derived profile includes functions that have not been defined in this EDIS FP.

content.sentence: The Workgroup solicits feedback regarding functions encountered in the development of a derived profile not encountered in the EDIS FP.
content.parserSentence: The Workgroup solicits feedback regarding functions encountered in the development of a derived profile not encountered in the EDIS FP.

content.sentence: Conformance Criteria
content.parserSentence: Conformance Criteria

content.sentence: Each function defined in the model or profiles is associated with specific conformance criteria which are evaluable statements (i.e. “the system shall capture, display and report all immunizations associated with a patient”) used to determine if a particular function is met.
content.parserSentence: Each function defined in the model or profiles is associated with specific conformance criteria which are evaluable statements (i.e. “the system shall capture, display and report all immunizations associated with a patient”) used to determine if a particular function is met.

content.sentence: Conformance criteria have been developed in accordance with the standards set forth by the EHR technical committee.
content.parserSentence: Conformance criteria have been developed in accordance with the standards set forth by the EHR technical committee.

content.sentence: In order to ensure consistent, unambiguous understanding and application of the functional profile, the use of a consistent set of keywords (normative verbs) have been employed to describe conformance requirements.
content.parserSentence: In order to ensure consistent, unambiguous understanding and application of the functional profile, the use of a consistent set of keywords (normative verbs) have been employed to describe conformance requirements.

content.sentence: The following chart, adapted from the EHR FM, illustrates the hierarchy of nomenclature.

content.sentence: For example, “capture” is used to describe a function that includes both direct entry “create” and indirect entry through another device “input”.

content.sentence: Similarly, “maintain” is used to describe a function that entails reading, updating, or removal of data.

content.sentence: EDIS Users
content.parserSentence: EDIS Users

content.sentence: The ED is a unique care setting where a number of non-clinical associates as well as administrators and managers must have access to the system.
content.parserSentence: The ED is a unique care setting where a number of non-clinical associates as well as administrators and managers must have access to the system.

content.sentence: Furthermore, users may at different times have different roles.
content.parserSentence: Furthermore, users may at different times have different roles.

content.sentence: For instance, a nurse may on one day work as a nurse, while on another day work as a nurse practitioner.
content.parserSentence: For instance, a nurse may on one day work as a nurse, while on another day work as a nurse practitioner.

content.sentence: This profile was developed for the US realm.
content.parserSentence: This profile was developed for the US realm.

content.sentence: However we feel it is highly applicable to international settings with the understanding that language used to describe potential users of the system may require clarification.
content.parserSentence: However we feel it is highly applicable to international settings with the understanding that language used to describe potential users of the system may require clarification.

content.sentence: The following table should be used as a guide to the nomenclature used to describe users who may interact with an EDIS.
content.parserSentence: The following table should be used as a guide to the nomenclature used to describe users who may interact with an EDIS.

content.sentence: This table is not intended to serve as a hierarchical description of ED roles or as a description of access control policies, attributes, or credentials, but is intended to provide a means to rigorously define different groups of users.
content.parserSentence: This table is not intended to serve as a hierarchical description of ED roles or as a description of access control policies, attributes, or credentials, but is intended to provide a means to rigorously define different groups of users.

content.sentence: For instance, functions pertaining to the functions related to prescribing are usually granted to physicians, physician assistants and nurse practitioners, so users of such functions would be described as a ‘licensed prescriber’ but not as a ‘user’ or a ‘provider’.
content.parserSentence: For instance, functions pertaining to the functions related to prescribing are usually granted to physicians, physician assistants and nurse practitioners, so users of such functions would be described as a ‘licensed prescriber’ but not as a ‘user’ or a ‘provider’.

content.sentence: EDIS Overview  and Functions
content.parserSentence: EDIS Overview  and Functions

content.sentence: The following section describes some of the major functions and tasks essential in an EDIS.
content.parserSentence: The following section describes some of the major functions and tasks essential in an EDIS.

content.sentence: Tracking
content.parserSentence: Tracking

content.sentence: In emergency medicine, the concept of tracking connotes multiple concepts.
content.parserSentence: In emergency medicine, the concept of tracking connotes multiple concepts.

content.sentence: Tracking may refer to the tracking of the patient’s physical location as well as the patient’s progress through an ED encounter (i.e. arrival, in room, awaiting consults, awaiting labs, ready for discharge).
content.parserSentence: Tracking may refer to the tracking of the patient’s physical location as well as the patient’s progress through an ED encounter (i.e. arrival, in room, awaiting consults, awaiting labs, ready for discharge).

content.sentence: Tracking physical location can be accomplished by capturing updates to the patient’s location that are manually entered by users into the system, or it can be done in an automated fashion using radio-frequency ID (RFID) or other technologies.
content.parserSentence: Tracking physical location can be accomplished by capturing updates to the patient’s location that are manually entered by users into the system, or it can be done in an automated fashion using radio-frequency ID (RFID) or other technologies.

content.sentence: The system should track patient physical location through all phases of visit, from pre-arrival through disposition.
content.parserSentence: The system should track patient physical location through all phases of visit, from pre-arrival through disposition.

content.sentence: At certain times the actual location of the patient may require supporting information.
content.parserSentence: At certain times the actual location of the patient may require supporting information.

content.sentence: For instance, a patient who has been sent to radiology may require his or her patient room to be “saved” because the patient’s family members or personal belongings remain.
content.parserSentence: For instance, a patient who has been sent to radiology may require his or her patient room to be “saved” because the patient’s family members or personal belongings remain.

content.sentence: Tracking the status of care is covered in Clinical Workflow Tracking and Task Management.
content.parserSentence: Tracking the status of care is covered in Clinical Workflow Tracking and Task Management.
content.comments: no specific activities so I didn't select logging / authorization.

content.sentence: Tracking of patient’s progress through the ED encounter requires the capture of certain milestones in the business logic behind the system.
content.parserSentence: Tracking of patient’s progress through the ED encounter requires the capture of certain milestones in the business logic behind the system.

content.sentence: For instance, when a patient is moved from the waiting room to a patient room, the time the patient entered the treatment area should be automatically captured.
content.parserSentence: For instance, when a patient is moved from the waiting room to a patient room, the time the patient entered the treatment area should be automatically captured.

content.sentence: Similarly, a chair in a hallway would be considered equivalent to a patient room in terms of capturing this milestone.
content.parserSentence: Similarly, a chair in a hallway would be considered equivalent to a patient room in terms of capturing this milestone.

content.sentence: Registration
content.parserSentence: Registration

content.sentence: Patient arrival and registration are relatively complex and time-sensitive tasks involving data capture of both clinical and administrative data.
content.parserSentence: Patient arrival and registration are relatively complex and time-sensitive tasks involving data capture of both clinical and administrative data.

content.sentence: In most cases, the EDIS is not the primary system used to capture the gamut of demographic or administrative information.
content.parserSentence: In most cases, the EDIS is not the primary system used to capture the gamut of demographic or administrative information.

content.sentence: Instead, a record is generated in the EDIS upon patient entry, and further demographic and administrative data are sent to the system via HL7 messaging once the patient is formally registered into the hospital ADT system.
content.parserSentence: Instead, a record is generated in the EDIS upon patient entry, and further demographic and administrative data are sent to the system via HL7 messaging once the patient is formally registered into the hospital ADT system.

content.sentence: Critical to this workflow is the ability to manage the patient before formal registration has occurred, the identification of a single patient ID and record in both the EDIS and hospital systems, timely generation of a hospital account or billing number to facilitate interoperability with other hospital systems.
content.parserSentence: Critical to this workflow is the ability to manage the patient before formal registration has occurred, the identification of a single patient ID and record in both the EDIS and hospital systems, timely generation of a hospital account or billing number to facilitate interoperability with other hospital systems.

content.sentence: The process of merging administrative data captured in the hospital system with the unique patient record in the EDIS should be largely automated, and only require human intervention if errors in either process prevent a certain match of the data.
content.parserSentence: The process of merging administrative data captured in the hospital system with the unique patient record in the EDIS should be largely automated, and only require human intervention if errors in either process prevent a certain match of the data.

content.sentence: Because the emergency department patient is ideally first encountered by a clinical provider (i.e. triage nurse) and not registration personnel, a search for past visits in the EDIS should be available to providers to retrieve medical summary data that has been captured in previous visits, including the patients’ problem list, medications or allergies.
content.parserSentence: Because the emergency department patient is ideally first encountered by a clinical provider (i.e. triage nurse) and not registration personnel, a search for past visits in the EDIS should be available to providers to retrieve medical summary data that has been captured in previous visits, including the patients’ problem list, medications or allergies.

content.sentence: While finding a patient’s record may take time, past encounter data may streamline the intake or triage process, especially for patients with complicated medical histories or for patients unable to give an accurate history.
content.parserSentence: While finding a patient’s record may take time, past encounter data may streamline the intake or triage process, especially for patients with complicated medical histories or for patients unable to give an accurate history.

content.sentence: Conversely, identification of a patient’s previous visits prior to triage or formal registration should not be required.
content.parserSentence: Conversely, identification of a patient’s previous visits prior to triage or formal registration should not be required.

content.sentence: In fact, it should be possible to enter a patient into the EDIS without any demographic information (i.e. John or Jane Doe).
content.parserSentence: In fact, it should be possible to enter a patient into the EDIS without any demographic information (i.e. John or Jane Doe).

content.sentence: Quick registration is another process that allows clinical providers to enter the minimal amount of data sufficient to generate a new encounter or account number for the patient.
content.parserSentence: Quick registration is another process that allows clinical providers to enter the minimal amount of data sufficient to generate a new encounter or account number for the patient.

content.sentence: This permits clinicians to order tests and other procedures on the patient although formal registration and verification of administrative data has not yet occurred.
content.parserSentence: This permits clinicians to order tests and other procedures on the patient although formal registration and verification of administrative data has not yet occurred.

content.sentence: Full registration is the process whereby administrative personnel capture the entire spectrum of demographic information including contacts, addresses, and insurance information.
content.parserSentence: Full registration is the process whereby administrative personnel capture the entire spectrum of demographic information including contacts, addresses, and insurance information.

content.sentence: Alternative workflows are possible and may be necessary for some EDIS implementations.
content.parserSentence: Alternative workflows are possible and may be necessary for some EDIS implementations.

content.sentence: Clinical Workflow and Task Management
content.parserSentence: Clinical Workflow and Task Management

content.sentence: In the ED, there exists a critical need for distributed communication of the status of workflow tasks.
content.parserSentence: In the ED, there exists a critical need for distributed communication of the status of workflow tasks.

content.sentence: An essential EDIS function is the management and display of tasks to be accomplished.
content.parserSentence: An essential EDIS function is the management and display of tasks to be accomplished.

content.sentence: In the pre-EHR era, this was accomplished by various artifacts including grease boards, chart racks, stickers, etc.
content.parserSentence: In the pre-EHR era, this was accomplished by various artifacts including grease boards, chart racks, stickers, etc.

content.sentence: Systems implemented in the ED must seek to achieve a level of embedded buy-in and participation as have these time-tested and home-grown artifacts.
content.parserSentence: Systems implemented in the ED must seek to achieve a level of embedded buy-in and participation as have these time-tested and home-grown artifacts.

content.sentence: Communication of priorities is difficult in the ED.
content.parserSentence: Communication of priorities is difficult in the ED.

content.sentence: Work to be done is constantly changing.
content.parserSentence: Work to be done is constantly changing.

content.sentence: For instance, a critically ill patient has the effect of immediate re-prioritizing all workflow.
content.parserSentence: For instance, a critically ill patient has the effect of immediate re-prioritizing all workflow.

content.sentence: In the ED, shifting of priorities is the norm, not the exception.
content.parserSentence: In the ED, shifting of priorities is the norm, not the exception.

content.sentence: The management of tasks within the EDIS requires the maintenance of a master set of tasks, the ability to invoke those tasks, and a method for displaying those tasks.
content.parserSentence: The management of tasks within the EDIS requires the maintenance of a master set of tasks, the ability to invoke those tasks, and a method for displaying those tasks.

content.sentence: Tasks include orders, consultations, clinical tasks such as transportation to radiology, and flags for patient follow-up, etc.
content.parserSentence: Tasks include orders, consultations, clinical tasks such as transportation to radiology, and flags for patient follow-up, etc.

content.sentence: Tasks must be assigned to at least one entity, and in the ED are usually assigned to a member of the healthcare team or to a department (i.e. radiology).
content.parserSentence: Tasks must be assigned to at least one entity, and in the ED are usually assigned to a member of the healthcare team or to a department (i.e. radiology).

content.sentence: Tasks are also either linked to a particular patient, or occasionally to infrastructure in the ED (i.e. a bed that needs cleaning).
content.parserSentence: Tasks are also either linked to a particular patient, or occasionally to infrastructure in the ED (i.e. a bed that needs cleaning).

content.sentence: The EDIS should be extensible enough to accommodate the complexity of clinical task routing according to local needs.
content.parserSentence: The EDIS should be extensible enough to accommodate the complexity of clinical task routing according to local needs.

content.sentence: For instance, in one ED, the assignment of an order for a “Chest Radiograph” may be assigned to the patient’s primary RN alone, who carries out the task of ordering the study in the hospital information system and contacting transport to take the patient to the radiology department (sub-optimal).
content.parserSentence: For instance, in one ED, the assignment of an order for a “Chest Radiograph” may be assigned to the patient’s primary RN alone, who carries out the task of ordering the study in the hospital information system and contacting transport to take the patient to the radiology department (sub-optimal).

content.sentence: In another ED, the same task might entail the creation of multiple sub-tasks to: alert the primary RN that the patient requires transport out of the department; alert the radiology technologist to perform the study; alert the transporter to transport the patient to radiology; send an HL7 message to the radiology system ordering the study.
content.parserSentence: In another ED, the same task might entail the creation of multiple sub-tasks to: alert the primary RN that the patient requires transport out of the department; alert the radiology technologist to perform the study; alert the transporter to transport the patient to radiology; send an HL7 message to the radiology system ordering the study.

content.sentence: The system must link every clinical task to a particular patient and resource.
content.parserSentence: The system must link every clinical task to a particular patient and resource.

content.sentence: Resources may include members of the health care team, objects such as stock items, and on occasion a place in the ED chart.
content.parserSentence: Resources may include members of the health care team, objects such as stock items, and on occasion a place in the ED chart.

content.sentence: For instance, an order for an ECG could be linked to the patient’s primary ED nurse, to the hospital heart station, to the ECG section of the chart to prompt the ED physician for an interpretation, and to the charge capture system.
content.parserSentence: For instance, an order for an ECG could be linked to the patient’s primary ED nurse, to the hospital heart station, to the ECG section of the chart to prompt the ED physician for an interpretation, and to the charge capture system.

content.sentence: The system must also display those tasks which have been ordered or initiated, but have not been completed, as well as display and notify providers about tasks which have returned results that are awaiting review.
content.parserSentence: The system must also display those tasks which have been ordered or initiated, but have not been completed, as well as display and notify providers about tasks which have returned results that are awaiting review.

content.sentence: The tracking and display of tasks takes two major forms:
content.parserSentence: The tracking and display of tasks takes two major forms:

content.sentence: 1) the display of the status of tasks for an individual patient, and
content.parserSentence: The tracking and display of tasks takes two major forms: the display of the status of tasks for an individual patient, and

content.sentence: 2) the display of tasks for a particular member of the healthcare team (i.e. MD, RN or Tech) or external department (i.e. Radiology, Laboratory, and Admitting).
content.parserSentence: The tracking and display of tasks takes two major forms: the display of tasks for a particular member of the healthcare team (i.e. MD, RN or Tech) or external department (i.e. Radiology, Laboratory, and Admitting).

content.sentence: In an EDIS, the optimal display of clinical tasks is visible, and communicates at a distance.
content.parserSentence: In an EDIS, the optimal display of clinical tasks is visible, and communicates at a distance.
content.comments: Safety requirement

content.sentence: Orders
content.parserSentence: Orders

content.sentence: The system must provide means to order laboratory, radiology, medications, nursing tasks, and materials management.
content.parserSentence: The system must provide means to order laboratory, radiology, medications, nursing tasks, and materials management.

content.sentence: Orders are a unique subset of clinical tasks that possess certain qualities.
content.parserSentence: Orders are a unique subset of clinical tasks that possess certain qualities.

content.sentence: As with all tasks, an individual order may actually comprise a number of bundled tasks.
content.parserSentence: As with all tasks, an individual order may actually comprise a number of bundled tasks.

content.sentence: For instance, an order for a complete blood count may comprise a number of sub-tasks, including obtaining the blood specimen, transporting the specimen to the lab, initiating the order in the laboratory system, and creating tasks to the physician to complete including review and documentation of results.
content.parserSentence: For instance, an order for a complete blood count may comprise a number of sub-tasks, including obtaining the blood specimen, transporting the specimen to the lab, initiating the order in the laboratory system, and creating tasks to the physician to complete including review and documentation of results.

content.sentence: For success, orders must be highly specific and customizable by personnel role, physical location, and patient-specific factors (i.e. major trauma patient).
content.parserSentence: For success, orders must be highly specific and customizable by personnel role, physical location, and patient-specific factors (i.e. major trauma patient).

content.sentence: The system must be sufficiently extensible to support institutional variations and preferences.
content.parserSentence: The system must be sufficiently extensible to support institutional variations and preferences.

content.sentence: For instance, the order for an ECG may be carried out by an ED RN in one institution, and a person from heart station in another.
content.parserSentence: For instance, the order for an ECG may be carried out by an ED RN in one institution, and a person from heart station in another.

content.sentence: Aerosol therapy may be the purview of nursing in one ED and respiratory care in another.
content.parserSentence: Aerosol therapy may be the purview of nursing in one ED and respiratory care in another.

content.sentence: Roles such as these may be shared or vary by time of day or day of week.
content.parserSentence: Roles such as these may be shared or vary by time of day or day of week.

content.sentence: Doppler ultrasound of the lower extremities to rule out venous thromboembolism may be done by the vascular service during the day and by radiology at night.
content.parserSentence: Doppler ultrasound of the lower extremities to rule out venous thromboembolism may be done by the vascular service during the day and by radiology at night.

content.sentence: Clinical Documentation
content.parserSentence: Clinical Documentation

content.sentence: The system must support the capture of clinical documentation by all ED providers including physicians, nurses, technologists, transporters, and any other providers of clinical care.
content.parserSentence: The system must support the capture of clinical documentation by all ED providers including physicians, nurses, technologists, transporters, and any other providers of clinical care.

content.sentence: The system should permit providers to document both observations and medical decision making and to reflect exactly what each provider wants to say.
content.parserSentence: The system should permit providers to document both observations and medical decision making and to reflect exactly what each provider wants to say.

content.sentence: A large part of routine data gathering in the ED is redundant.
content.parserSentence: A large part of routine data gathering in the ED is redundant.

content.sentence: For example, a patient’s list of medications may be incorporated from a previous encounter, verified and updated in triage.
content.parserSentence: For example, a patient’s list of medications may be incorporated from a previous encounter, verified and updated in triage.

content.sentence: This process is frequently duplicated by the physician or other provider as part of their history and documentation.
content.parserSentence: This process is frequently duplicated by the physician or other provider as part of their history and documentation.

content.sentence: This information re-use requires the ability to manage inter-practitioner discrepancies, allowing providers to agree, comment, update, or annotate information gleaned at different points during the encounter.
content.parserSentence: This information re-use requires the ability to manage inter-practitioner discrepancies, allowing providers to agree, comment, update, or annotate information gleaned at different points during the encounter.

content.sentence: Sometimes this means commenting on findings that are not duplicated, sometimes it means verification of findings, but in all cases it means not having discrepancies which can be of severe medical and medical-legal consequence.
content.parserSentence: Sometimes this means commenting on findings that are not duplicated, sometimes it means verification of findings, but in all cases it means not having discrepancies which can be of severe medical and medical-legal consequence.

content.sentence: For instance, a patient with chest pain may be asked by an nurse if they have any allergies.
content.parserSentence: For instance, a patient with chest pain may be asked by an nurse if they have any allergies.

content.sentence: The patient says no and is administered aspirin as part of a standard protocol for chest pain.
content.parserSentence: The patient says no and is administered aspirin as part of a standard protocol for chest pain.

content.sentence: Upon questioning by the physician the patient reports an allergy to aspirin.
content.parserSentence: Upon questioning by the physician the patient reports an allergy to aspirin.

content.sentence: Proper documentation of an encounter such as this would require proper time stamps for when data was available and documented.
content.parserSentence: Proper documentation of an encounter such as this would require proper time stamps for when data was available and documented.

content.sentence: It would obviously be wrong for the documentation to ultimately reflect aspirin allergy without noting that “No allergies” was documented by the RN.
content.parserSentence: It would obviously be wrong for the documentation to ultimately reflect aspirin allergy without noting that “No allergies” was documented by the RN.

content.sentence: Managing Record Completion
content.parserSentence: Managing Record Completion

content.sentence: While ED documentation is ideally completed by the time a patient leaves the department, this is rarely possible.
content.parserSentence: While ED documentation is ideally completed by the time a patient leaves the department, this is rarely possible.

content.sentence: ED clinicians frequently must wait until the end or stay after an assigned shift, to find time to complete records.
content.parserSentence: ED clinicians frequently must wait until the end or stay after an assigned shift, to find time to complete records.

content.sentence: Moreover, ED records are often created discontinuously, and systems need to consider provisions for permitting staggered, delayed, and offsite completion of records as well as monitoring and reporting their completion.
content.parserSentence: Moreover, ED records are often created discontinuously, and systems need to consider provisions for permitting staggered, delayed, and offsite completion of records as well as monitoring and reporting their completion.

content.sentence: Furthermore,
content.parserSentence: Furthermore,

content.sentence: EDIS systems must consider the process of authorship (one or more providers may need to document at the same time), signature, authentication, completion and addendum of ED records.
content.parserSentence: EDIS systems must consider the process of authorship (one or more providers may need to document at the same time), signature, authentication, completion and addendum of ED records.

content.sentence: The system should provide a means for a provider to display patient records needing attention or completion.
content.parserSentence: The system should provide a means for a provider to display patient records needing attention or completion.

content.sentence: The system should provide a means to create addendums to documents that have already been signed and hence cannot be changed.
content.parserSentence: The system should provide a means to create addendums to documents that have already been signed and hence cannot be changed.

content.sentence: The system must also allow for completion of the encounter record in a discontinuous sequence, but to retain particular formatting.
content.parserSentence: The system must also allow for completion of the encounter record in a discontinuous sequence, but to retain particular formatting.

content.sentence: For instance, a physician may write discharge instructions and prescriptions to discharge a patient quickly, but not document the history and physical until much later.
content.parserSentence: For instance, a physician may write discharge instructions and prescriptions to discharge a patient quickly, but not document the history and physical until much later.

content.sentence: However, the cart would need to reflect the encounter in a more traditional sequence.
content.parserSentence: However, the cart would need to reflect the encounter in a more traditional sequence.

content.sentence: ED Physicians sometime do not get documentation completed at the end of each shift.
content.parserSentence: ED Physicians sometime do not get documentation completed at the end of each shift.

content.sentence: Although some stay afterward to complete the work, others take the work home and complete the medical record over the next 24-36 hours.
content.parserSentence: Although some stay afterward to complete the work, others take the work home and complete the medical record over the next 24-36 hours.

content.sentence: It is conceivable in a busy shift that a physician may want to look over his or her clinical documentation before signing the chart.
content.parserSentence: It is conceivable in a busy shift that a physician may want to look over his or her clinical documentation before signing the chart.

content.sentence: Although this is not ideal, facilities should have the option to add this feature, when the workload demands it.
content.parserSentence: Although this is not ideal, facilities should have the option to add this feature, when the workload demands it.

content.sentence: Because of the commonly irregular, sometimes chaotic, and piecemeal acquisition of information in the ED, documentation is often accomplished in fragments, and sometimes outside of the sequencing used in other care spaces.
content.parserSentence: Because of the commonly irregular, sometimes chaotic, and piecemeal acquisition of information in the ED, documentation is often accomplished in fragments, and sometimes outside of the sequencing used in other care spaces.

content.sentence: Documentation should be able to be done in any order, with good perspectives of what has and has not been completed, as well as what remains to be completed.
content.parserSentence: Documentation should be able to be done in any order, with good perspectives of what has and has not been completed, as well as what remains to be completed.

content.sentence: Post-Disposition Management
content.parserSentence: Post-Disposition Management

content.sentence: Numerous tasks may exist after the completion of patient care and disposition.
content.parserSentence: Numerous tasks may exist after the completion of patient care and disposition.

content.sentence: The system needs to provide a means to track all flavors of outstanding patient issues after the ED visit is completed.
content.parserSentence: The system needs to provide a means to track all flavors of outstanding patient issues after the ED visit is completed.

content.sentence: For example, the system should allow providers to identify patients with outstanding laboratory, radiological, or other diagnostic study issues, or to arrange follow-up care that could not be adjudicated prior to discharge.
content.parserSentence: For example, the system should allow providers to identify patients with outstanding laboratory, radiological, or other diagnostic study issues, or to arrange follow-up care that could not be adjudicated prior to discharge.

content.sentence: These tasks may be delegated to a particular person or may be displayed to entire ED staff.
content.parserSentence: These tasks may be delegated to a particular person or may be displayed to entire ED staff.

content.sentence: In addition, the system needs to track patients requiring administrative action after discharge (i.e. patient satisfaction or other non-clinical follow-up).
content.parserSentence: In addition, the system needs to track patients requiring administrative action after discharge (i.e. patient satisfaction or other non-clinical follow-up).

content.sentence: Furthermore, the system need to provide a means to reconcile preliminary diagnostic test results with the final interpretations of the services requested (i.e. reconcile ED interpretation with ultimate radiologist dictation).
content.parserSentence: Furthermore, the system need to provide a means to reconcile preliminary diagnostic test results with the final interpretations of the services requested (i.e. reconcile ED interpretation with ultimate radiologist dictation).

content.sentence: Hence, interoperability with radiology information system and ECG system (not traditional interfaces) becomes desirable (see interoperability).
content.parserSentence: Hence, interoperability with radiology information system and ECG system (not traditional interfaces) becomes desirable (see interoperability).

content.sentence: Statement:  Identify and maintain a single patient record for each patient.
content.parserSentence: Statement:  Identify and maintain a single patient record for each patient.

content.sentence: Description: A single patient record is needed for legal purposes, as well as to organize information unambiguously for the provider.

content.sentence: All health information is captured and linked to the patient record.

content.sentence: EDIS are frequently thought of as being encounter based.

content.sentence: However, it is advantageous to tie specific information directly to a patient so that if a patient returns, legacy data may be incorporated and updated when beginning a new encounter.
content.parserSentence: However, it is advantageous to tie specific information directly to a patient so that if a patient returns, legacy data may be incorporated and updated when beginning a new encounter.

content.parserSentence: The system shall associate key identifier information (e.g., system ID, medical record number) with each patient record.

content.sentence: 5) The system shall associate interventions to be administered to the unique identity of the patient.
content.parserSentence: The system shall associate interventions to be administered to the unique identity of the patient.

content.sentence: 6) The system shall provide the ability to uniquely identify a patient and tie the record to a single patient.
content.parserSentence: The system shall provide the ability to uniquely identify a patient and tie the record to a single patient.

content.sentence: 7) The system shall provide the ability, through a controlled method, to merge or link dispersed information for an individual patient upon recognizing the identity of the patient.

content.sentence: 8) When health information has been mistakenly associated with a patient, the system shall provide the ability to mark the information as erroneous in the record of the patient in which it was mistakenly associated and represent  that information as erroneous in all outputs containing that information.

content.sentence: EDC.1.1.2.1 – ED  EDIS Registration
content.parserSentence: EDC.1.1.2.1 – ED  EDIS Registration

content.sentence: Statement: Identify the patient in the EDIS and initiate a new encounter.
content.parserSentence: Statement: Identify the patient in the EDIS and initiate a new encounter.

content.sentence: Description: ED workflow is unique in that care must be supported and documented immediately upon arrival.
content.parserSentence: Description: ED workflow is unique in that care must be supported and documented immediately upon arrival.

content.sentence: The system must be able to immediately generate a new patient encounter without the need to identify the patient or previous records.
content.parserSentence: The system must be able to immediately generate a new patient encounter without the need to identify the patient or previous records.

content.sentence: To maximize usability, when time permits, identification of a previous patient record in the EDIS should be possible to facilitate the triage process by recovering prior medications, allergies, problems.
content.parserSentence: To maximize usability, when time permits, identification of a previous patient record in the EDIS should be possible to facilitate the triage process by recovering prior medications, allergies, problems.

content.sentence: Data entry is minimized and time can be spent verifying, updating, and correcting data.
content.parserSentence: Data entry is minimized and time can be spent verifying, updating, and correcting data.
content.comments: nothing specific to draw a requirement from ....

content.sentence: 1) The system shall be able to immediately generate a new encounter at the time of patient arrival.
content.parserSentence: The system shall be able to immediately generate a new encounter at the time of patient arrival.

content.sentence: 2) The system shall permit the users to identify a patient’s pre-existing record in the system at the time of arrival.
content.parserSentence: The system shall permit the users to identify a patient’s pre-existing record in the system at the time of arrival.

content.sentence: 3) The system should permit the user to search by core demographic data including name, DOB, administrative gender, patient ID number and account number.
content.parserSentence: The system should permit the user to search by core demographic data including name, DOB, administrative gender, patient ID number and account number.

content.sentence: 4) The system should provide the ability to retrieve legacy data once the patient is identified.
content.parserSentence: The system should provide the ability to retrieve legacy data once the patient is identified.

content.sentence: 5) The system shall provide the ability to assign an identity to a patient at the time of arrival.
content.parserSentence: The system shall provide the ability to assign an identity to a patient at the time of arrival.

content.sentence: 6) The system shall provide the ability to assign either a previously established identity for the patient or to create a new identity.
content.parserSentence: The system shall provide the ability to assign either a previously established identity for the patient or to create a new identity.

content.sentence: 7) The system shall provide the ability to create a temporary identity (i.e. John Doe) for the patient.
content.parserSentence: The system shall provide the ability to create a temporary identity (i.e. John Doe) for the patient.

content.sentence: 8) The system shall provide the ability to reconcile temporary identity assignments after care has been initiated, and further information becomes available
content.parserSentence: The system shall provide the ability to reconcile temporary identity assignments after care has been initiated, and further information becomes available

content.sentence: EDC.1.1.2.2 – ED  Quick Registration
content.parserSentence: EDC.1.1.2.2 – ED  Quick Registration

content.sentence: Statement: Receive an account number from the hospital ADT system without complete supporting demographics, in order to facilitate patient care before registration is complete.

content.sentence: Description: The registration process, including the verification of full demographics data, insurance, contact information, etc is frequently time consuming.
